CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper September 26, 1959, pg. B2, reads: "In Celebration of Pittsburgh's Bicentennial - Pa. Training School Marks 'Pioneer Day' - Taking the Oath - As Miss Peters, girl friend of all the girl students at the Pennsylvania Training School, two other officials, dressed in pioneer (Indian) garb, appear to be taking a solemn oath of allegiance. Naturally, the youngsters enjoyed seeing the oldsters promising to follow the straight and narrow path of righteousness. - All Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Man in fringed frontiersman costume holding long rifle and standing at microphone on field for "Pioneer Day" celebration at Pennsylvania Training School, Canonsburg
